column5: Well i've fished the river 4 times this year prior to this morning with no luck at all. Pounding a spot that used to produce easily 10-20 hits in a morning, even last year i'd get one or two in a morning. So got up at five am hoped my luck would change and off i went. Ended up with four fish on and got these two. Things are still looking pretty grim for the salmon run up here these two had the typical thin skinny bodies, should still taste good once they're through the smoker. Atleast there are still a few around. Anyhow heres a couple pics.
was this caught in a creek? cause i see grass (i never go to Georgian bay)
Is that a Wally Diver?  Love that colour, never seen that one before.
Nottawasaga river.    Ya its not a walleye diver but a rapala taildancer. Those salmon get angry at that little baby rainbow colour...lol
WTG, very nice silver fish, caught darker fish offshore.  Bet they are good safe eaters too.

Some fresh fish you got there, nice work!!!...I went to a local notty haunt the other day that should have 100's by now (well it would have 5 years ago),..saw 2..Lol  ..steady declines on the nookies,..hope the chromers stay true to form
it's almost funny to see them at that size in the river.  Nice catch.
